import React, {Fragment, useCallback, useState} from "react"; import {Card, Form,Checkbox, Button, Select, Page, Stack, TextField, Heading, ChoiceList,} from "@shopify/polaris"; import Dropdown from 'react-dropdown'; import 'react-dropdown/style.css'; import './AttributeCreation'; import {Drop_2} from './Drop2'; export class Drop_1 extends React.Component{ constructor(){ super(); this.state = { selectedValue:'' } this.handleChange = this.handleChange.bind(this); } renderSelectedForm(param) { switch(param) { case 'form_name1': return

Attribute Properties

Attribute label


For internal use. Must be unique with no spaces and length <= 30. Let it empty for auto generation


Attributes are sorted in ascending order (eg: Attribute with sorting order 1 will be displayed on top of Attribute 2)


Type*:


The default value for this attribute when it is shown to your customers


The placeholder specifies a short hint that describes the expected value of this field


Tick if this attribute is required to be filled by your customers


Input Validation:
